meanings.definition: The quality or state of being furtive.
meanings.sent1: Her furtivenesses made her seem mysterious to others.
meanings.sent2: The furtivenesses of the spy were evident in his sneaky movements.
meanings.sent3: The cat's furtivenesses while stalking a mouse were comical to watch.
meanings.sent4: The furtivenesses of the shadows seemed to dance in the dimly lit room.
meanings.sent5: The furtivenesses of the ninja were so silent and swift that no one noticed his presence.

meanings.definition: The act of behaving in a secretive or sly manner.
meanings.sent1: The furtivenesses of the thief allowed him to steal without being caught.
meanings.sent2: She noticed his furtivenesses as he glanced around before whispering a secret.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon's furtivenesses in stealing food from the campsite were amusing to the campers.
meanings.sent4: The furtivenesses of the fox as it hunted its prey were like a silent predator in the night.
meanings.sent5: His furtivenesses during the game of hide-and-seek made him the ultimate champion.
